intro: Hedyotis digyna, commonly known as the small-flowered bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to temperate regions of Asia and Europe. It typically grows to a height of about 15–30 centimeters and features small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. The plant has slender, ascending stems covered in fine hairs and possesses opposite, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or stream banks. Hedyotis digyna is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
